Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. [**Known lastname **] was admitted to the [**Hospital1 18**] on [**2186-9-9**] via transfer from
[**Hospital6 5016**].  He was evaluated by the orthopaedic and
trauma surgery departments.  He was admitted to the Trauma ICU
under the care of the trauma service.  Orthopaedics reduced the
right hip fracture and placed a femoral traction pin.
Cardiology was consulted for a right bundle branch block seen on
EKG.  Cardiology felt it was a contusion from the crash.    On
[**2186-9-10**] he was transferred to the floor for further care.  On
[**2186-9-11**] he was taken to the operating room for an ORIF of his
right acetabular fracture.  He tolerated the procedure well, was
extubated, transferred to the recovery room and then to the
floor.  His care was also transferred to the orthopaedic surgery
service.  He was seen by physical therapy to improve his
strength and mobility.  On [**2186-9-12**] he was transfused with 1 unit
of packed red blood cells due to acute post operative anemia.
On [**2186-9-15**] he was again transfused with 2units of packed red
blood cells due to acute post operative anemia.

The rest of his hospital stay was uneventful with his lab data
and vital signs within normal limits and his pain controlled.
He is being discharged today in stable condition.

denies

(1) Tablet, Delayed Release (E.C.) PO Q24H (every 24 hours).

hours) as needed.

Discharge Instructions:
Continue to be touch toe weight bearing on your right leg

Continue your lovenox injections for a total of 4 weeks after
surgery

If you notice any increased redness, drainge, or swelling or if
you have a temperature greater than 101.5 please call the office
or come to the emergency department
Physical Therapy:

 Right upper extremity:  Full weight bearing

Treatments Frequency:

appointment

You may apply a dry sterile dressing daily or as needed for
drainage or comfort
